analysis.Summary: Vue 3 dropdown component that toggles a content panel on click, supports custom component or text labels, and closes when clicking outside.
analysis.Purpose: Provides a reusable dropdown UI element in the application for showing contextual menus or any arbitrary slot content.

Components.name: Dropdown
Components.role: Main component wrapper. Renders a label (string or custom component) and toggles visibility of the dropdown content.

Components.name: TransitionTranslateY
Components.role: Vue <transition> wrapper that animates the dropdown panel on show/hide using a translateY effect.

Components.name: v-click-outside (clickOutside)
Components.role: Custom directive that listens for clicks outside the dropdown element and invokes a handler to close it.

Functions.name: clickedOutside
Functions.purpose: Sets the dropdown's open state to false when a click outside the component is detected.

Functions.name: isComponentLabel
Functions.purpose: Computed property that returns true if the `label` prop is an object (i.e., a custom component config), false if itâ€™s a simple string.

analysis.Usage:
Import the component and use in templates:
import Dropdown from 'components/Dropdown/Dropdown.vue';
<Dropdown label="Options" align="right">...</Dropdown>
Notes: The `label` prop accepts either a string or an object with `{ component, props, class }` to render a custom component as the label.
Default alignment is `left`; pass `align="right"` to align the dropdown panel on the right edge.
Click handler on the root div uses `.stop` modifier to prevent event propagation.
The CSS for `.dropdown-content` positions the panel absolutely and applies a box-shadow; hover-based display rules are commented out.
